alert.note: Alert for Cavalier; Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 11:19AM CDT until April 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Traill and Norman Counties. Pembina River at Walhalla affecting Cavalier and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Kittson, Marshall, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Marshall, Walsh and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Dakota... Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Red River basin river flooding will continue. While many sites in the southern basin have crested but remain in flood, sites within the central and northern basin along and near the mainstem Red River are cresting or have yet to crest. Recent snowmelt and rainfall are creating additional rises along the Pembina River. No significant precipitation is expected over the next 7 days. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pembina River at Walhalla. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Friday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 9.0 feet by next Friday. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
